author: mimus
post: Colin, I understand that you do not intend to reproduce a large scale model: that would be way to premature to do so and a complete waste of effort. What I meant is rather that: (1) it is difficult, or even close to impossible, to get a “nice” 3 D effect using a small 3 D model. The task appears simpler by doubling the size of the 3 D model as there will be more vertical height, therefore more gradation from the scorching; (2) do you have some clear 100x or 200x photographs of the linen fibers of your experiments (hopefully taken with a microscope with possibly different lighting conditions)?; (3) don’t you get a gradual amount of dehydration (and potentially of colors) of the fibers depending on the distance from the model to the cloth? And, by the way, “Anonymous” is clearly Yannick Clement..
title: It’s a negative. It’s 3D. Yes? Maybe? Sort Of?
